column5: I want too pull a small boggen behind the guide flip over, I was thinking of making it so the smaller one was hard mounted to the back of the flip over,may be a couple of inches behind.  Any input would be much appreciated.  thanks Paul.

I would just hard mount it aswell with a quick release Paul.Piece of 1 inch square tube that slides over two pieces of 3/4 inch tube with thos bal lock pins.  I can see you cant get that drafting out of yer head eh.LOL   I,ll see if I can draw something up.LOL

Its gotta have a swivel  point in there  somewhere, or your gonna tear up your hut.  I used to tow a box with all my gear, then put my hut on top strapped on. It worked ok, but there is no need for that much gear.  Sinker
Yeh I forgot about the left turns.LOL  This will work.

Paul, I have that same set-up on my 8 ft. Equinox Trail Boggan, and a full hitch frame is the way to go. Reinforce the hitch point on the lead sleigh with wood or metal, I chose wood. I did that because where I go, portage trails are the norm, need the extra length of a full hitch assembly to tackle the tight corners without the sleighs contacting each other.
